# Random forest

```{r}
# Specify the tunning configuration (mtry hyperparameter depends on the number of columns)
seed.rf <- 42
set.seed(seed.rf) 

mtry <- c(2, 5, 10)
min.node.size <- seq(1, 10, 2)  # Reducir el rango
hiperparametros <- expand.grid(mtry =  mtry)
                               #min.node.size = seq(1, 30, 2),
                               #min.node.size=min.node.size,
                               #splitrule = "gini")
```


```{r}

# Seeds
seed.rf <- 42
set.seed(seed.rf)

seeds <- vector(mode = "list", length = (particiones * repeticiones) + 1)

for (i in 1:(particiones * repeticiones)) {
  seeds[[i]] <- sample.int(500, nrow(hiperparametros)) 
}
# genera un vector de nrow(hiperparametros) números aleatorios entre 1 y 500.
#Esto asegura que cada combinación de hiperparámetros tenga una semilla diferente en cada iteración.

seeds[[(particiones * repeticiones) + 1]] <- sample.int(500, 1)

# Training control
```



```{r}
# Training control

cross_val_rf <- trainControl(
  method = "repeatedcv",
  number = particiones,
  repeats = repeticiones,
  returnResamp = "final",
  verboseIter = FALSE,
  allowParallel = TRUE,
  classProbs = TRUE,
  seeds = seeds)

# Training 

# Convertir los niveles de Train.rf$sensi a números también

trainData$Y <- factor(as.numeric(factor(trainData$Y)))
trainData$Y <- factor(trainData$Y, levels = c("1", "2"))
levels(trainData$Y) <- make.names(levels(trainData$Y))

```



```{r}
library(caret)

# 
# RF <- caret::train(Y ~ ., data = trainData, 
#                       method = "rf",   # Método para random forest
#                       trControl = cross_val, 
#                       tuneGrid = grid_rf,  # Parámetro mtry
#                       metric = "Accuracy")  # Métrica para clasificación
RF_matrix_nodic_cargafx <- function(df_train, model, grid, metrica = "Accuracy", control) {

  
  # Entrenar el modelo
  RF_matrix_carga <- caret::train(
    Y ~ .,
    data = df_train,
    method = model,
    tuneGrid = grid,
    metric = metrica,
    trControl = control
  )
  
  # Mostrar resumen
  print(RF_matrix_carga)
  plot(RF_matrix_carga)
  
  # Guardar resultado
  #save(RF_equipo, file = paste0(title, ".rda"))
  
  return(RF_matrix_carga)
}

RF_matrix_carga<-RF_matrix_nodic_cargafx(df_train=trainData, model="rf", grid=hiperparametros, metrica="Accuracy", control=cross_val_rf )
print(RF_matrix_carga)
```


```{r}

# KNN <- caret::train(formula,

KNN_matrix_carga_fx <- function(df_train, model, grid, metrica = "Accuracy",  control, preProcess) {

    tuneGrid = grid,

  return(KNN_matrix_carga)
}
```

# GLMNET

```{r}

tuneGrid <- expand.grid(
  alpha = seq(0, 1, by = 0.1),  # From 0 (Ridge) to 1 (Lasso)
  lambda = 10^seq(-3, 3, length = 100)  # Logarithmic scale for lambda
)
# Seeds
seed.rf <- 42
set.seed(seed.rf)
max_sample <- max(500, nrow(tuneGrid) * 2)
seeds <- vector(mode = "list", length = (particiones * repeticiones) + 1)

for (i in 1:(particiones * repeticiones)) {
  seeds[[i]] <- sample.int(max_sample, nrow(tuneGrid)) 
}

seeds[[(particiones * repeticiones) + 1]] <- sample.int(500, 1)

# Training control
```



```{r}
# Training control

cross_val_glm <- trainControl(
  method = "repeatedcv",
  number = particiones,
  repeats = repeticiones,
  returnResamp = "final",
  verboseIter = FALSE,
  allowParallel = TRUE,
  classProbs = TRUE,
  seeds = seeds)
```



```{r}
# GLM <- caret::train(formula, 
#                   data = trainData,  
#                    method = "glmnet",

#                    trControl = cross_val,

GLM_matrix_carga_fx <- function(df_train, model, grid, metrica = "Accuracy",  control) {

  
  # Entrenar el modelo
  GLM_matrix_carga <- caret::train(
    Y ~ .,
    data = df_train,
    method = model,
    tuneGrid = grid,
    metric = metrica,
    trControl = control
  )
  
  # Mostrar resumen
  print(GLM_matrix_carga)
  plot(GLM_matrix_carga)
  
  # Guardar resultado
 # save(GLM_matrix, file = paste0(title, ".rda"))
  
  return(GLM_matrix_carga)
}

GLM_matrix_carga<-GLM_matrix_carga_fx(df_train=trainData, model="glmnet", grid=tuneGrid, control=cross_val_glm )
print(GLM_matrix_carga)
```


```{r}
# Imprimir los mejores hiperparámetros
best_params <- GLM_matrix_carga$bestTune
print("Best Hyperparameters:")
print(best_params)

# Extraer accuracy y kappa del mejor modelo
# Buscamos la fila que corresponde a los mejores hiperparámetros en el data frame model$results
best_model_index <- apply(GLM_matrix_carga$results, 1, function(row) {
  all(row[1:length(best_params)] == as.numeric(best_params))
})

best_model_results <- GLM_matrix_carga$results[best_model_index, ]

# Imprimir accuracy y kappa del mejor modelo
accuracy <- best_model_results$Accuracy
kappa <- best_model_results$Kappa

print("Accuracy of the Best Model:")
print(accuracy)

print("Kappa of the Best Model:")
print(kappa)

```

```{r}
library(caret)
accuracyRF_carga <- RF_metrics_carga$overall["Accuracy"]
kappaRF_carga <- RF_metrics_carga$overall["Kappa"]
# Métricas por clase
sensitivityRF_carga <- RF_metrics_carga$byClass["Sensitivity"]
specificityRF_carga <- RF_metrics_carga$byClass["Specificity"]
precisionRF_carga <- RF_metrics_carga$byClass["Pos Pred Value"]
recallRF_carga <- RF_metrics_carga$byClass["Sensitivity"]  # Igual a sensitivity
f1_scoreRF_carga <- RF_metrics_carga$byClass["F1"]
npvRF_carga <- RF_metrics_carga$byClass["Neg Pred Value"]
prevalenceRF_carga <- RF_metrics_carga$byClass["Prevalence"]
detection_rateRF_carga <- RF_metrics_carga$byClass["Detection Rate"]
balanced_accuracyRF_carga <- RF_metrics_carga$byClass["Balanced Accuracy"]

# Calcular LR+ y LR- que no vienen directamente en confusionMatrix
LR_plusRF_carga <- sensitivityRF_carga / (1 - specificityRF_carga)
LR_minusRF_carga <- (1 - sensitivityRF_carga) / specificityRF_carga

# Para manejar valores especiales
LR_plusRF_carga <- ifelse(is.nan(LR_plusRF_carga) | is.infinite(LR_plusRF_carga), NA, LR_plusRF_carga)
LR_minusRF_carga <- ifelse(is.nan(LR_minusRF_carga) | is.infinite(LR_minusRF_carga), NA, LR_minusRF_carga)

# Crear un dataframe con todas las métricas
metricsRF_matrix_carga <- data.frame(
  Metric = c("Accuracy", "Kappa", "Sensitivity", "Specificity", "Precision", 
             "F1_Score", "NPV", "Prevalence", "Detection_Rate", 
             "Balanced_Accuracy", "LR+", "LR-", "AUC"),
  RF_matrix_carga = c(accuracyRF_carga, kappaRF_carga, sensitivityRF_carga, specificityRF_carga, precisionRF_carga, 
            f1_scoreRF_carga, npvRF_carga, prevalenceRF_carga, detection_rateRF_carga, 
            balanced_accuracyRF_carga, LR_plusRF_carga, LR_minusRF_carga, AUC_RF_carga))

# Mostrar los resultados
print(metricsRF_matrix_carga)

```

```{r}
  Kappa = sapply(modelos_matrix_dico, function(m) max(m$results$Kappa, na.rm = TRUE)),
  mtry = sapply(modelos_matrix_dico, function(m) m$bestTune$mtry),
  min.node.size = sapply(modelos_matrix_dico, function(m) m$bestTune$min.node.size)
)

# Ordenamos los modelos de mejor a peor Accuracy
resultados_modelos <- resultados_modelos[order(-resultados_modelos$Accuracy), ]

print(head(resultados_modelos, 20)) 

```

```{r}
mejor_modelo <- modelos_matrix_dico[[as.character(mejor_num_trees)]]
```

```{r}
specificityRanger_matrix_dich_carga <- Ranger_metrics_matrix_carga$byClass["Specificity"]
precisionRanger_matrix_dich_carga <- Ranger_metrics_matrix_carga$byClass["Pos Pred Value"]
recallRanger_matrix_dich_carga <- Ranger_metrics_matrix_carga$byClass["Sensitivity"]  # Igual a sensitivity
f1_scoreRanger_matrix_dich_carga <- Ranger_metrics_matrix_carga$byClass["F1"]
npvRanger_matrix_dich_carga <- Ranger_metrics_matrix_carga$byClass["Neg Pred Value"]
prevalenceRanger_matrix_dich_carga <- Ranger_metrics_matrix_carga$byClass["Prevalence"]
detection_rateRanger_matrix_dich_carga <- Ranger_metrics_matrix_carga$byClass["Detection Rate"]
balanced_accuracyRanger_matrix_dich_carga <- Ranger_metrics_matrix_carga$byClass["Balanced Accuracy"]

# Calcular LR+ y LR- que no vienen directamente en confusionMatrix
LR_plusRanger_matrix_dich_carga <- sensitivityRanger_matrix_dich_carga / (1 - specificityRanger_matrix_dich_carga)
LR_minusRanger_matrix_dich_carga <- (1 - sensitivityRanger_matrix_dich_carga) / specificityRanger_matrix_dich_carga

# Para manejar valores especiales

LR_minusRanger_matrix_dich_carga <- ifelse(is.nan(LR_minusRanger_matrix_dich_carga) | is.infinite(LR_minusRanger_matrix_dich_carga), NA, LR_minusRanger_matrix_dich_carga)

            f1_scoreRanger_matrix_dich_carga, npvRanger_matrix_dich_carga, prevalenceRanger_matrix_dich_carga, detection_rateRanger_matrix_dich_carga, 
            balanced_accuracyRanger_matrix_dich_carga, LR_plusRanger_matrix_dich_carga, LR_minusRanger_matrix_dich_carga, AUC_Ranger_matrix_dich_carga))
```
